hm2FwMib.name: hm2FwMib

revisions.description: - Modified Interface Mapping Table for L3 and DynFw - Use HmActionValue instead of TruthValue
- Restructured IF mapping tables - Added variable for pending actions

hm2FwMib.contactinfo: Postal: Stuttgarter Str. 45-51 72654 Neckartenzlingen Germany Phone: +49 - 7127 -14 -0 E-mail: hac.support@belden.com
hm2FwMib.description: SNMP interface for Hirschmann Firewall modules. Copyright (C)

hm2DynFwMaxRules.name: hm2DynFwMaxRules
hm2DynFwMaxRules.description: Maximum number of allowed rules for dynamic firewalling.

hm2L3MaxRules.name: hm2L3MaxRules
hm2L3MaxRules.description: Maximum number of allowed rules for L3 firewalling.

hm2ResetStatistics.name: hm2ResetStatistics
hm2ResetStatistics.description: Setting this value to action(2) will reset the statistics of the whole firewall module. It will be set to noop(1) automatically after reset.

hm2FlushTables.name: hm2FlushTables
hm2FlushTables.description: Setting this value to action(2) will flush all connection tracking states. It will be set to noop(1) automatically after table flush.

hm2DefaultPolicy.name: hm2DefaultPolicy
hm2DefaultPolicy.description: The default policy for forwarding packets: o accept(1): Packets matching this rule are accepted and will be forwarded o drop(2): Packets matching this rule will be silently discarded o reject(3): Packets matching this rule will be dropped and the originator gets informed by an ICMP message

hm2ConnTrackValidateCheckSum.name: hm2ConnTrackValidateCheckSum
hm2ConnTrackValidateCheckSum.description: This value describes, whether the Firewall connection tracking in the Linux kernel shall validate the protocol checksums. Disable this validation (false) improves routing throughput.

hm2DynFwRuleAppliedTrap.name: hm2DynFwRuleAppliedTrap
hm2DynFwRuleAppliedTrap.description: A rule of the dynamic firewall was applied. The rule is identified by the given rule index of the rule table.

hm2DynFwRuleAppliedAndLoggedTrap.name: hm2DynFwRuleAppliedAndLoggedTrap
hm2DynFwRuleAppliedAndLoggedTrap.description: A rule of the dynamic firewall was applied and logged according to the current logging mechanism. The rule is identified by the given rule index of the rule table.

hm2DynFwRuleCount.name: hm2DynFwRuleCount
hm2DynFwRuleCount.description: Number of current dynamic firewalls rules

hm2DynFwIfMappingRuleCount.name: hm2DynFwIfMappingRuleCount
hm2DynFwIfMappingRuleCount.description: Number of current DynFw IF mapping entries.

hm2DynFwRulePendingActions.name: hm2DynFwRulePendingActions
hm2DynFwRulePendingActions.description: This value describes, whether the DynFW rule table was modified but not yet written to the firewall implementation (set to true). After writing all modifications to the firewall, the value switches automatically back to false.

hm2DynFwCommitPendingActions.name: hm2DynFwCommitPendingActions
hm2DynFwCommitPendingActions.description: Setting this value to action(2) writes not yet committed changes to the firewall (DynFW and Interface Mapping Table). After writing all modifications, the value switches automatically back to noop(1).

hm2DynFwRuleTable.name: hm2DynFwRuleTable
hm2DynFwRuleTable.description: The list of rules for this dynamic firewall

hm2DynFwRuleIndex.name: hm2DynFwRuleIndex
hm2DynFwRuleIndex.description: Rule index of this dynamic firewall rule

hm2DynFwSourceAddress.name: hm2DynFwSourceAddress
hm2DynFwSourceAddress.description: The source address of the packet to filter. Allowed formats are: - keyword 'any' - single address ('10.0.0.1') - CIDR address range ('10.0.0.0/8') - netobject ('$name')

hm2DynFwSourcePort.name: hm2DynFwSourcePort
hm2DynFwSourcePort.description: The source port of the packet to filter. Allowed formats are: - keyword 'any' - single port ('10') - port range with first and last port separated by hyphen ('10-15') - comma separated list of ports ('1235,25,123') - combination of the points above ('10,25-30,125,1993') The number of named ports (1 for each individual port, 2 for port ranges) must not exceed 15.

hm2DynFwTargetAddress.name: hm2DynFwTargetAddress
hm2DynFwTargetAddress.description: The destination address of the packet to filter. Allowed formats are: - keyword 'any' - single address ('10.0.0.1') - CIDR address range ('10.0.0.0/8') - netobject ('$name')

hm2DynFwTargetPort.name: hm2DynFwTargetPort
hm2DynFwTargetPort.description: The destination port of the packet to filter. Allowed formats are: - keyword 'any' - single port ('10') - port range with first and last port separated by hyphen ('10-15') - comma separated list of ports ('1235,25,123') - combination of the points above ('10,25-30,125,1993') The number of named ports (1 for each individual port, 2 for port ranges) must not exceed 15.

hm2DynFwProto.name: hm2DynFwProto
hm2DynFwProto.description: The IP protocol (RFC 791) for protocol-independent filtering. The following values are currently supported: o icmp(1): internet control message protocol (RFC 792) o igmp(2): internet group management protocol o ipip(3): IP in IP tunnelling (RFC 1853) o tcp(4): transmission control protocol (RFC 793) o udp(5): user datagram protocol (RFC 768) o esp(6): IPsec encapsulated security payload (RFC 2406) o ah(7): IPsec authentication header (RFC 2402) o icmpv6(8): internet control message protocol for IPv6 o any(9): apply to all protocols

hm2DynFwRuleParams.name: hm2DynFwRuleParams
hm2DynFwRuleParams.description: Additional parameters to this rule as string. A parameter has the syntax: <param>=<val> Parameters are separated by a comma. If more than one value is given for a parameter, values are separated by a |-sign Following paramters are defined based on the different protocols: o icmp: type=<ICMP type> (specify ICMP type to filter) code=<ICMP code> (specify ICMP code to filter) o tcp: frag=<true/false> (apply to fragments) flags=<SYN/ACK/FIN> (apply to packets with give flags o udp/tcp: state=<new/rel/est> (apply to packets according current state of connection> o general: mac=<MAC> (specify source MAC address for this rule)

hm2DynFwAction.name: hm2DynFwAction
hm2DynFwAction.description: The action of the corresponding rule: o accept(1): Packets matching this rule are accepted and will be forwarded o drop(2): Packets matching this rule will be silently discarded o reject(3): Packets matching this rule will be dropped and the originator gets informed by an ICMP message

hm2DynFwLog.name: hm2DynFwLog
hm2DynFwLog.description: Set to true if application of this rule shall be logged

hm2DynFwTrap.name: hm2DynFwTrap
hm2DynFwTrap.description: Set to true if application of this rule shall send a trap.

hm2DynFwRowStatus.name: hm2DynFwRowStatus
hm2DynFwRowStatus.description: This is a standard row status value: - active(1): The rule is active. Note that until committed, the rule will not be applied. - notInService(2): The rule is inactive because of user action. - notReady(3): The rule is inactive because of agent action. - createAndGo(4): Create the rule with default parameters activated. - createAndWait(5): Create the rule inactive. - destroy(6): Delete the rule. You cannot delete a rule with interface mappings to it.

hm2DynFwDescription.name: hm2DynFwDescription
hm2DynFwDescription.description: User defined textual description related to this rule.

hm2DynFwRuleIfMappingTable.name: hm2DynFwRuleIfMappingTable
hm2DynFwRuleIfMappingTable.description: Table for mapping L3 rules to interfaces

hm2DynFwRuleIfMappingEntry.name: hm2DynFwRuleIfMappingEntry
hm2DynFwRuleIfMappingEntry.description: Entry in rule interface mapping table

hm2DynFwIfmRuleIndex.name: hm2DynFwIfmRuleIndex
hm2DynFwIfmRuleIndex.description: The index of the DynFw rule this mapping entry is assigned to. The DynFw rule must exist before creation of mapping entry.

hm2DynFwIfmDirection.name: hm2DynFwIfmDirection
hm2DynFwIfmDirection.description: Meanings: - ingress(1): Apply this rule to packets arriving on this interface - egress(2): Apply this rule to packets leaving from this interface - both(3): Apply this rule to packets coming in and going out on this interface. If an ingress and an egress interface are given, this is taken to mean that the rule shall apply to packets arriving on the ingress interface AND to be leaving on the egress interface. A rule without ingress interface matches on all packets going out to the egress interface given, and vice versa.

hm2DynFwIfmPriority.name: hm2DynFwIfmPriority
hm2DynFwIfmPriority.description: The priority is the sorting key for rules in to this interface. They don't need to be unique, but no clear order can be assumed among rules with the same priority. Priorities are processed in ascending order (0 highest priority).

hm2DynFwIfmInterface.name: hm2DynFwIfmInterface
hm2DynFwIfmInterface.description: The interface this mapping entry is applied to. This has to be either an hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIfIndex or an hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanIfIndex. Note that for physical interfaces this only works if the corresponding hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceRoutingMode is set to enable.

hm2DynFwIfmRowStatus.name: hm2DynFwIfmRowStatus
hm2DynFwIfmRowStatus.description: The RowStatus value for this entry with the usual meanings: - active(1): The interface mapping is in place - notInService(2): The interface mapping is not in place because the user said so - notReady(3): The interface mapping is not in place because the agent said so - createAndGo(4): Create this mapping with the default priority and activate it. - createAndWait(5): Create this mapping deactivated. - destroy(6): Destroy this interface mapping.

hm2DynFwStatsTtPck.name: hm2DynFwStatsTtPck
hm2DynFwStatsTtPck.description: Total number of packets processed by the dynamic firewall

hm2DynFwStatsTtPckSize.name: hm2DynFwStatsTtPckSize
hm2DynFwStatsTtPckSize.description: Total number of bytes processed by the dynamic firewall

hm2DynFwStatsTtPckDenDrop.name: hm2DynFwStatsTtPckDenDrop
hm2DynFwStatsTtPckDenDrop.description: Total number of packets dropped or denied by the dynamic firewall

hm2DynFwStatsTtPckAccepted.name: hm2DynFwStatsTtPckAccepted
hm2DynFwStatsTtPckAccepted.description: Total number of packets accepted by the dynamic firewall

hm2DynFwStatsRuleTable.name: hm2DynFwStatsRuleTable
hm2DynFwStatsRuleTable.description: Table of per-rule statistics of the dynamic firewall

hm2DynFwStatsRuleEntry.name: hm2DynFwStatsRuleEntry
hm2DynFwStatsRuleEntry.description: Statistics table entry for the dynamic firewall

hm2DynFwStatsPacketCount.name: hm2DynFwStatsPacketCount
hm2DynFwStatsPacketCount.description: Number of packets matched by this rule

hm2DynFwStatsPacketSize.name: hm2DynFwStatsPacketSize
hm2DynFwStatsPacketSize.description: Number of bytes processed by this rule

hm2DynFwStatsLastApplied.name: hm2DynFwStatsLastApplied
hm2DynFwStatsLastApplied.description: Local system time (hm2SystemLocalTime) when the rule was applied the last time

hm2L3RuleAppliedTrap.name: hm2L3RuleAppliedTrap
hm2L3RuleAppliedTrap.description: A rule of the L3 firewall was applied. The rule is identified by the given rule index of the rule table.

hm2L3RuleAppliedAndLoggedTrap.name: hm2L3RuleAppliedAndLoggedTrap
hm2L3RuleAppliedAndLoggedTrap.description: A rule of the L3 firewall was applied and logged according the current logging mechanism. The rule is identified by the given rule index of the rule table.

hm2L3IfMappingRuleCount.name: hm2L3IfMappingRuleCount
hm2L3IfMappingRuleCount.description: Number of current L3 IF mapping entries.

hm2L3RulePendingActions.name: hm2L3RulePendingActions
hm2L3RulePendingActions.description: This value describes, whether the L3 rule table was modified but not yet written to the firewall implementation (set to true). After writing all modifications to the firewall, the value switches automatically back to false.

hm2L3CommitPendingActions.name: hm2L3CommitPendingActions
hm2L3CommitPendingActions.description: Setting this value to action(2) writes not yet committed changes to the firewall (L3 and Interface Mapping Table). After writing all modifications, the value switches automatically back to noop(1).

hm2L3RuleTable.name: hm2L3RuleTable
hm2L3RuleTable.description: The list of L3 rules for this firewall

hm2L3RuleIndex.name: hm2L3RuleIndex
hm2L3RuleIndex.description: Rule index of this L3 rule

hm2L3SourceAddress.name: hm2L3SourceAddress
hm2L3SourceAddress.description: The source address of the packet to filter. Allowed formats are: - keyword 'any' - single address ('10.0.0.1') - CIDR address range ('10.0.0.0/8') - netobject ('$name') - a prepending '!' selects the complement set

hm2L3SourcePort.name: hm2L3SourcePort
hm2L3SourcePort.description: The source port of the packet to reroute. Allowed formats are: - keyword 'any' - single port ('10') - port range with first and last port separated by hyphen ('10-15') - comma separated list of ports ('1235,25,123') - combination of the points above ('10,25-30,125,1993') The number of named ports (1 for each individual port, 2 for port ranges) must not exceed 15.

hm2L3TargetAddress.name: hm2L3TargetAddress
hm2L3TargetAddress.description: The destination address of the packet to filter. Allowed formats are: - keyword 'any' - single address ('10.0.0.1') - CIDR address range ('10.0.0.0/8') - netobject ('$name')

hm2L3TargetPort.name: hm2L3TargetPort
hm2L3TargetPort.description: The destination port of the packet to. Allowed formats are: - keyword 'any' - single port ('10') - port range with first and last port separated by hyphen ('10-15') - comma separated list of ports ('1235,25,123') - combination of the points above ('10,25-30,125,1993') The number of named ports (1 for each individual port, 2 for port ranges) must not exceed 15.

hm2L3Proto.name: hm2L3Proto
hm2L3Proto.description: The IP protocol (RFC 791) for protocol-independent filtering. The following values are currently supported: o icmp(1): internet control message protocol (RFC 792) o igmp(2): internet group management protocol o ipip(3): IP in IP tunnelling (RFC 1853) o tcp(4): transmission control protocol (RFC 793) o udp(5): user datagram protocol (RFC 768) o esp(6): IPsec encapsulated security payload (RFC 2406) o ah(7): IPsec authentication header (RFC 2402) o icmpv6(8): internet control message protocol for IPv6 o any(9): apply to all protocols

hm2L3RuleParams.name: hm2L3RuleParams
hm2L3RuleParams.description: Additional parameters to this rule as string. A parameter has the syntax: <param>=<val> Parameters are separated by a comma. If more than one value is given for a parameter, values are separated by a |-sign (pipe). Following parameters are defined based on the different protocols: o icmp: type=<ICMP type> (specify ICMP type to filter) code=<ICMP code> (specify ICMP code to filter) o tcp: flags=<SYN/ACK/FIN> (apply to packets with given flags) o general: state=<new/rel/est> (apply to packets according to current state of connection>) mac=<MAC> (specify source MAC address for this rule) frag=<true/false> (apply to fragments)

hm2L3Action.name: hm2L3Action
hm2L3Action.description: The action of the corresponding rule: o accept(1): Packets matching this rule are accepted and will be forwarded o drop(2): Packets matching this rule will be silently discarded o reject(3): Packets matching this rule will be dropped and the originator gets informed by an ICMP message o enforce-modbus(4): Packets matching this rule are enforced by modbus enforcer and will be forwarded or discarded. The selected protocol should be tcp or udp o enforce-opc(5): Packets matching this rule are enforced by opc enforcer and will be forwarded or discarded. The selected protocol should be tcp

hm2L3Log.name: hm2L3Log
hm2L3Log.description: Set to true if application of this rule shall be logged

hm2L3Trap.name: hm2L3Trap
hm2L3Trap.description: Set to true if application of this rule shall send a trap.

hm2L3RowStatus.name: hm2L3RowStatus
hm2L3RowStatus.description: This is a standard row status value: - active(1): The rule is active. Note that until committed, the rule will not be applied. You cannot activate the rule if an enforcer mappings to an inactive profile. - notInService(2): The rule is inactive because of user action. - notReady(3): The rule is inactive because of agent action. - createAndGo(4): Create the rule with default parameters activated. - createAndWait(5): Create the rule inactive. - destroy(6): Delete the rule. You cannot delete a rule with interface mappings to it.

hm2L3Description.name: hm2L3Description
hm2L3Description.description: User defined textual description related to this rule.

hm2DPIProfileIndex.name: hm2DPIProfileIndex
hm2DPIProfileIndex.description: The index of the DPI profile this rule is assigned to depending on enforcer action. Value 0 no DPI profile this rule is assigned to. You cannot assign the rule to an inactive profile if an active enforcer will mapping to it.

hm2L3RuleIfMappingTable.name: hm2L3RuleIfMappingTable
hm2L3RuleIfMappingTable.description: Table for mapping L3 rules to interfaces

hm2L3RuleIfMappingEntry.name: hm2L3RuleIfMappingEntry
hm2L3RuleIfMappingEntry.description: Entry in rule interface mapping table

hm2L3IfmRuleIndex.name: hm2L3IfmRuleIndex
hm2L3IfmRuleIndex.description: The index of the L3 rule this mapping entry is assigned to. The rule must exist before the mapping entry can be created.

hm2L3IfmDirection.name: hm2L3IfmDirection
hm2L3IfmDirection.description: Meanings: - ingress(1): Apply this rule to packets arriving on this interface - egress(2): Apply this rule to packets leaving from this interface - both(3): Apply this rule to packets coming in and going out on this interface. If an ingress and an egress interface are given, this is taken to mean that the rule shall apply to packets arriving on the ingress interface AND to-be leaving on the egress interface. A rule without ingress interface matches on all packets going out to the egress interface given, and vice versa.

hm2L3IfmPriority.name: hm2L3IfmPriority
hm2L3IfmPriority.description: The priority is the sorting key for rules in to this interface. They don't need to be unique, but no clear order can be assumed among rules with the same priority. Priorities are processed in ascending order (0 highest priority.

hm2L3IfmInterface.name: hm2L3IfmInterface
hm2L3IfmInterface.description: The interface this mapping entry is assigned to. This has to be either an hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIfIndex or an hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanIfIndex. Note that for physical interfaces this only works if the corresponding hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceRoutingMode is set to enable.

hm2L3IfmRowStatus.name: hm2L3IfmRowStatus
hm2L3IfmRowStatus.description: The RowStatus value for this entry with the usual meanings: - active(1): The interface mapping is in place - notInService(2): The interface mapping is not in place because the user said so - notReady(3): The interface mapping is not in place because the agent said so - createAndGo(4): Create this mapping with the default priority and activate it. - createAndWait(5): Create this mapping deactivated. - destroy(6): Destroy this interface mapping.

hm2L3StatsTotalPck.name: hm2L3StatsTotalPck
hm2L3StatsTotalPck.description: Total number of packets processed by the L3 firewall

hm2L3StatsTotalPckSize.name: hm2L3StatsTotalPckSize
hm2L3StatsTotalPckSize.description: Total number of bytes processed by the L3 firewall

hm2L3StatsTotalPckDenDrop.name: hm2L3StatsTotalPckDenDrop
hm2L3StatsTotalPckDenDrop.description: Total number of packets dropped or denied by the L3 firewall

hm2L3StatsTotalPckAccepted.name: hm2L3StatsTotalPckAccepted
hm2L3StatsTotalPckAccepted.description: Total number of packets accepted by the L3 firewall

hm2L3StatsRuleTable.name: hm2L3StatsRuleTable
hm2L3StatsRuleTable.description: Table of per-rule statistics of the L3 firewall

hm2L3StatsRuleEntry.name: hm2L3StatsRuleEntry
hm2L3StatsRuleEntry.description: Statistics table entry for the L3 firewall

hm2L3StatsPacketCount.name: hm2L3StatsPacketCount
hm2L3StatsPacketCount.description: Number of packets matched by this rule

hm2L3StatsPacketSize.name: hm2L3StatsPacketSize
hm2L3StatsPacketSize.description: Number of bytes processed by this rule

hm2L3StatsLastApplied.name: hm2L3StatsLastApplied
hm2L3StatsLastApplied.description: Time of last application of the rule in seconds since the Unix epoch.

hm2DPIProfileModbusPendingActions.name: hm2DPIProfileModbusPendingActions
hm2DPIProfileModbusPendingActions.description: This value describes, whether the DPI MODBUS profile table was modified but not yet written to the enforcer implementation (set to true). After writing all modifications to the enforcer, the value switches automatically back to false.

hm2DPIProfileModbusCommitPendingActions.name: hm2DPIProfileModbusCommitPendingActions
hm2DPIProfileModbusCommitPendingActions.description: Setting this value to action(2) writes not yet committed changes to the enforcer (DPI MODBUS Profile Table). After writing all modifications, the value switches automatically back to noop(1).

hm2DPIProfileOpcPendingActions.name: hm2DPIProfileOpcPendingActions
hm2DPIProfileOpcPendingActions.description: This value describes, whether the L3 OPC profile table was modified but not yet written to the enforcer implementation (set to true). After writing all modifications to the enforcer, the value switches automatically back to false.

hm2DPIProfileOpcCommitPendingActions.name: hm2DPIProfileOpcCommitPendingActions
hm2DPIProfileOpcCommitPendingActions.description: Setting this value to action(2) writes not yet committed changes to the enforcer (DPI OPC Profile Table). After writing all modifications, the value switches automatically back to noop(1).

hm2DPIProfileModbusTable.name: hm2DPIProfileModbusTable
hm2DPIProfileModbusTable.description: The list of DPI MODBUS profiles for this enforcer

hm2DPIProfileModbusIndex.name: hm2DPIProfileModbusIndex
hm2DPIProfileModbusIndex.description: Profile index of this DPI MODBUS profile

hm2DPIProfileModbusDescription.name: hm2DPIProfileModbusDescription
hm2DPIProfileModbusDescription.description: User defined textual description related to this profile.

hm2DPIProfileModbusFunctionType.name: hm2DPIProfileModbusFunctionType
hm2DPIProfileModbusFunctionType.description: The function types of the corresponding function codes: o readonly(1): Selects read only function codes for the function code list. o readwrite(2): Selects read write function codes for the function code list. o programming(3): Selects programming function codes for the function code list. o all(4): Selects all possible function codes for the function code list. Any function code will be allowed. o advanced(5): Keeps the function code list from the previous selection and makes it editable by the user.

hm2DPIProfileModbusFunctionCodeList.name: hm2DPIProfileModbusFunctionCodeList
hm2DPIProfileModbusFunctionCodeList.description: The function codes for this enforcer as string. A function code has the syntax: <val> Function codes are separated by a comma. If more than one value is given for a function code, values are separated by a | -sign (pipe). Following function codes are defined: <1..255>|<0-65535>|<0-65535> (apply to packets with given function codes <1..255>, address range <0-65535>, address range <0-65535>) 1|<0-65535> (apply to packets with given function code read coils, coil address range <0-65535>) 2|<0-65535> (apply to packets with given function code read discrete inputs, input address range <0-65535>) 3|<0-65535> (apply to packets with given function code read holding registers, register address range <0-65535>) 4|<0-65535> (apply to packets with given function code read input registers, register address range <0-65535>) 5|<0-65535> (apply to packets with given function code write single coil, coil address range <0-65535>) 6|<0-65535> (apply to packets with given function code write single register, register address range <0-65535>) 7 (apply to packets with given function code read exception status) 8 (apply to packets with given function code diagnostic) 11 (apply to packets with given function code get com event counter) 12 (apply to packets with given function code get comm event log) 13 (apply to packets with given function code program (584/984)) 14 (apply to packets with given function code poll (584/984)) 15|<0-65535> (apply to packets with given function code write multiple coils, coil address range <0-65535>) 16|<0-65535> (apply to packets with given function code write multiple registers, register address range <0-65535>) 17 (apply to packets with given function code report slave id) 20 (apply to packets with given function code read file record) 21 (apply to packets with given function code write file record) 22|<0-65535> (apply to packets with given function code mask write register, register address range <0-65535>) 23|<0-65535>|<0-65535> (apply to packets with given function code read/write multiple registers, read address range <0-65535>, write address range <0-65535>) 24|<0-65535> (apply to packets with given function code read fifo queue, pointer address range <0-65535>) 40 (apply to packets with given function code program (concept)) 42 (apply to packets with given function code concept symbol table) 43 (apply to packets with given function code encapsulated interface transport) 48 (apply to packets with given function code advantech co. ltd. - management functions) 66 (apply to packets with given function code scan data inc. - expanded read holding registers) 67 (apply to packets with given function code scan data inc. - expanded write holding registers) 90 (apply to packets with given function code unity programming/ofs) 100 (apply to packets with given function code scattered register read) 125 (apply to packets with given function code schneider electric - firmware replacement) 126 (apply to packets with given function code schneider electric - program)

hm2DPIProfileModbusUnitIdentifierList.name: hm2DPIProfileModbusUnitIdentifierList
hm2DPIProfileModbusUnitIdentifierList.description: Unit identifiers for this enforcer as string. A unit identifier has the syntax: <val> To specify no options, the value 'none' must be given. Unit identifiers are separated by a comma. Following unit identifiers are defined: <0..255> (apply to packets for which a unit identifier is set)

hm2DPIProfileModbusSanityCheck.name: hm2DPIProfileModbusSanityCheck
hm2DPIProfileModbusSanityCheck.description: Set to true if apply to packets for which a sanity check including format and specification shall be done

hm2DPIProfileModbusException.name: hm2DPIProfileModbusException
hm2DPIProfileModbusException.description: Set to true if apply to packets for which a device exception message shall be sent

hm2DPIProfileModbusReset.name: hm2DPIProfileModbusReset
hm2DPIProfileModbusReset.description: Set to true if apply to packets for which a reset connection message shall be sent

hm2DPIProfileModbusRowStatus.name: hm2DPIProfileModbusRowStatus
hm2DPIProfileModbusRowStatus.description: This is a standard row status value: - active(1): The profile is active. You cannot modify it. - notInService(2): The profile is inactive because of user action. You cannot inactivate the profile if an active enforcer mappings to it. - notReady(3): The profile is inactive because of agent action. - createAndGo(4): Create the profile with default parameters activated. - createAndWait(5): Create the profile inactive. - destroy(6): Delete the profile. You cannot delete the active profile or if an enforcer mappings to it.

hm2DPIProfileOpcTable.name: hm2DPIProfileOpcTable
hm2DPIProfileOpcTable.description: The list of DPI OPC profiles for this enforcer

hm2DPIProfileOpcIndex.name: hm2DPIProfileOpcIndex
hm2DPIProfileOpcIndex.description: Profile index of this DPI OPC profile

hm2DPIProfileOpcDescription.name: hm2DPIProfileOpcDescription
hm2DPIProfileOpcDescription.description: User defined textual description related to this profile.

hm2DPIProfileOpcSanityCheck.name: hm2DPIProfileOpcSanityCheck
hm2DPIProfileOpcSanityCheck.description: Set to true if apply to packets for which a sanity check including format and specification shall be done

hm2DPIProfileOpcFragmentCheck.name: hm2DPIProfileOpcFragmentCheck
hm2DPIProfileOpcFragmentCheck.description: Set to true if apply to packets for which a fragment check shall be done

hm2DPIProfileOpcTimeoutConnect.name: hm2DPIProfileOpcTimeoutConnect
hm2DPIProfileOpcTimeoutConnect.description: Set to nonzero if apply to packets for which a timeout at connect in seconds shall be done. Value 0 disables this match criteria.

hm2DPIProfileOpcRowStatus.name: hm2DPIProfileOpcRowStatus
hm2DPIProfileOpcRowStatus.description: This is a standard row status value: - active(1): The profile is active. You cannot modify it. - notInService(2): The profile is inactive because of user action. You cannot inactivate the profile if an active enforcer mappings to it. - notReady(3): The profile is inactive because of agent action. - createAndGo(4): Create the profile with default parameters activated. - createAndWait(5): Create the profile inactive. - destroy(6): Delete the profile. You cannot delete the active profile or if an enforcer mappings to it.

hm2FLMAdminState.name: hm2FLMAdminState
hm2FLMAdminState.description: Enable or disable the Firewall Learning Mode.

hm2FLMAction.name: hm2FLMAction
hm2FLMAction.description: Actions to control the Firewall Learning Mode.

hm2FLML3Entries.name: hm2FLML3Entries
hm2FLML3Entries.description: Number of Layer 3 entries in the connection table.

hm2FLMMaxEntries.name: hm2FLMMaxEntries
hm2FLMMaxEntries.description: Number of maximum interface entries that can be selected.

hm2FLMInterfaceTable.name: hm2FLMInterfaceTable
hm2FLMInterfaceTable.description: The list of interfaces selected for Firewall Learning Mode.

hm2FLMInterfaceEntry.name: hm2FLMInterfaceEntry
hm2FLMInterfaceEntry.description: Interface selected for Firewall Learning Mode.

hm2FLMInterfaceRowStatus.name: hm2FLMInterfaceRowStatus
hm2FLMInterfaceRowStatus.description: This is a standard row status value: - active(1): The interface is active. - notInService(2): The interface is inactive because routing was disabled. - notReady(3): The interface is inactive because of agent action. - createAndGo(4): Create the interface with default parameters activated. - createAndWait(5): Create the interface inactive. - destroy(6): Delete the interface.

hm2FwCompliance.name: hm2FwCompliance
hm2FwCompliance.description: The compliance statement for an SNMP entity which implements the Hirschmann firewall MIB.

hm2FwGeneralGroup.name: hm2FwGeneralGroup
hm2FwGeneralGroup.description: A collection of all Hirschmann objects provided by the firewall module.

hm2FwNotificationsGroup.name: hm2FwNotificationsGroup
hm2FwNotificationsGroup.description: A collection of all Hirschmann notifications provided by the firewall module.
